description.narrative: By September 2015, national, departmental and local institutions that are part of the National Disaster Prevention and Assistance System, and related programmes for assisting populations affected by the armed conflict, have increased their capacity to prevent and provide assistance in emergencies in the framework of the CCC (Core Commitments for Children)., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, institutional and community environments have enhanced their capacity to prevent and protect children and adolescents from violence, exploitation, and the effects of the armed conflict and natural disasters.

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Children associated with armed forces and armed groups - prevention and response
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, national, departmental and local institutions that are part of the National Disaster Prevention and AssistanceSystem, and related programmes for assisting populations affected by the armed conflict, have increased their capacity to preventand provide assistance in emergencies in the framework of the CCC (Core Commitments for Children).
Number of secretaries of education that design and implement action plans for preparedness, response and recovery from emergencies
Level (%) of implementation of the action plan for the WASH cluster (proportion of satisfactory outputs against planned products)

baseline.value: Agreed action plan for the WASH cluster (9 outputs planned) (2013).
ICBF is familiar with the community based nutritional recovery modality and is in the process of reviewing experiences and preparing supporting documentation.

title.narrative: Number of indigenous and Afro-Colombian children, adolescents and women for whom the access to health services, education, nutrition, water and sanitation, protection and prevention of HIV has been improved in the framework of the CCC.

baseline.value: In June of 2011, 164,000 indigenous and Afro-Colombian children, adolescents and women that have been affected by violence, displacement and natural disasters, have access to basic services.
